verses.verse: Then came <S%H935><s%> all the tribes <S%H7626><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> to David <S%H1732><s%> unto Hebron <S%H2275><s%>, and spoke <S%H559><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Behold <S%H6106><s%>, we are your bone and your flesh <S%H1320><s%>.

Also in time past <S%H865><s%>, when Saul <S%H7586><s%> was king <S%H4428><s%> over us <S%H3318><s%>, you were he that led out and brought in <S%H935><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%>: and the Lord <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to you <S%H7462><s%>, You shall feed my people <S%H5971><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%>, and you shall be a captain <S%H5057><s%> over Israel <S%H3478><s%>.

So all the elders <S%H2205><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> came <S%H935><s%> to the king <S%H4428><s%> to Hebron <S%H2275><s%>; and king <S%H4428><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> made <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%> with them in Hebron <S%H2275><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%>: and they anointed <S%H4886><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> over Israel <S%H3478><s%>.
David <S%H1732><s%> was thirty <S%H7970><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> when he began to reign <S%H4427><s%>, and he reigned <S%H4427><s%> forty <S%H705><s%> years <S%H8141><s%>.

In Hebron <S%H2275><s%> he reigned <S%H4427><s%> over Judah <S%H3063><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> and six <S%H8337><s%> months <S%H2320><s%>: and in Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> he reigned <S%H4427><s%> thirty <S%H7970><s%> and three <S%H7969><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> over all Israel <S%H3478><s%> and Judah <S%H3063><s%>.

And the king <S%H4428><s%> and his men <S%H582><s%> went <S%H3212><s%> to Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> unto the Jebusites <S%H2983><s%>, the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%>: which spoke <S%H559><s%> unto David <S%H1732><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Except you take away <S%H5493><s%> the blind <S%H5787><s%> and the lame <S%H6455><s%>, you shall not come in <S%H935><s%> here <S%H559><s%>: thinking, David <S%H1732><s%> cannot come in here <S%H935><s%>.
Nevertheless David <S%H1732><s%> took <S%H3920><s%> the strong hold <S%H4686><s%> of Zion <S%H6726><s%>: the same is the city <S%H5892><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%>.

And David <S%H1732><s%> said <S%H559><s%> on that day <S%H3117><s%>, Whoever gets up <S%H5060><s%> to the gutter <S%H6794><s%>, and strikes <S%H5221><s%> the Jebusites <S%H2983><s%>, and the lame <S%H6455><s%> and the blind <S%H5787><s%>, that are hated <S%H8130><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%>'s soul <S%H5315><s%>, he shall be chief and captain <S%H559><s%>. That is why they said, The blind <S%H5787><s%> and the lame <S%H6455><s%> shall not come <S%H935><s%> into the house <S%H1004><s%>.

So David <S%H1732><s%> lived <S%H3427><s%> in the fort <S%H4686><s%>, and called <S%H7121><s%> it the city <S%H5892><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%>. And David <S%H1732><s%> built <S%H1129><s%> round about <S%H5439><s%> from Millo <S%H4407><s%> and inward <S%H1004><s%>.
And David <S%H1732><s%> went <S%H3212><s%> on <S%H1980><s%>, and grew great <S%H1419><s%>, and the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of hosts was with him <S%H6635><s%>.

And Hiram <S%H2438><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Tyre <S%H6865><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> messengers <S%H4397><s%> to David <S%H1732><s%>, and cedar <S%H730><s%> trees <S%H6086><s%>, and carpenters <S%H2796><s%>, and masons <S%H7023><s%>: and they built <S%H1129><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> an house <S%H1004><s%>.

And David <S%H1732><s%> perceived <S%H3045><s%> that the Lord <S%H3068><s%> had established <S%H3559><s%> him king <S%H4428><s%> over Israel <S%H3478><s%>, and that he had exalted <S%H5375><s%> his kingdom <S%H4467><s%> for his people <S%H5971><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%>'s sake.

And David <S%H1732><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> him more concubines <S%H6370><s%> and wives <S%H802><s%> out of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>, after <S%H310><s%> he was come <S%H935><s%> from Hebron <S%H2275><s%>: and there were yet sons <S%H1121><s%> and daughters <S%H1323><s%> born <S%H3205><s%> to David <S%H1732><s%>.

And these be the names <S%H8034><s%> of those that were born <S%H3209><s%> unto him in Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>; Shammua <S%H8051><s%>, and Shobab <S%H7727><s%>, and Nathan <S%H5416><s%>, and Solomon <S%H8010><s%>,
Ibhar <S%H2984><s%> also <S%H474><s%>, and Elishua, and Nepheg <S%H5298><s%>, and Japhia <S%H3309><s%>,
And Elishama <S%H476><s%>, and Eliada <S%H450><s%>, and Eliphalet <S%H467><s%>.

But when the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> that they had anointed <S%H4886><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> over Israel <S%H3478><s%>, all the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> came up <S%H5927><s%> to seek <S%H1245><s%> David <S%H1732><s%>; and David <S%H1732><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> of it <S%H3381><s%>, and went down to the hold <S%H4686><s%>.
The Philistines <S%H6430><s%> also came <S%H935><s%> and spread <S%H5203><s%> themselves in the valley <S%H6010><s%> of Rephaim <S%H7497><s%>.

And David <S%H1732><s%> inquired <S%H7592><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Shall I go up <S%H5927><s%> to the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>? will you deliver <S%H5414><s%> them into my hand <S%H3027><s%>? And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto David <S%H1732><s%>, Go up <S%H5927><s%>: for I will doubtless <S%H5414><s%> deliver <S%H5414><s%> the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> into your hand <S%H3027><s%>.

And David <S%H1732><s%> came <S%H935><s%> to Baal <S%H1188><s%>–perazim, and David <S%H1732><s%> struck <S%H5221><s%> them there <S%H559><s%>, and said, The Lord <S%H3068><s%> has broken forth <S%H6555><s%> upon my enemies <S%H341><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> me <S%H6556><s%>, as the breach of waters <S%H4325><s%>. Therefore he called <S%H7121><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of that place <S%H4725><s%> Baal <S%H1188><s%>–perazim.
And there they left <S%H5800><s%> their images <S%H6091><s%>, and David <S%H1732><s%> and his men <S%H582><s%> burned them <S%H5375><s%>.
And the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> came up <S%H5927><s%> yet again <S%H3254><s%>, and spread <S%H5203><s%> themselves in the valley <S%H6010><s%> of Rephaim <S%H7497><s%>.

And when David <S%H1732><s%> inquired <S%H7592><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, he said <S%H559><s%>, You shall not go up <S%H5927><s%>; but circle <S%H5437><s%> behind <S%H310><s%> them <S%H935><s%>, and come upon them over against <S%H4136><s%> the mulberry trees <S%H1057><s%>.

And let it be <S%H8085><s%>, when you hear the sound <S%H6963><s%> of a going <S%H6807><s%> in the tops <S%H7218><s%> of the mulberry trees <S%H1057><s%>, that then you shall move <S%H2782><s%>: for then shall the Lord <S%H3068><s%> go out <S%H3318><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> you <S%H5221><s%>, to strike the army <S%H4264><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>.

And David <S%H1732><s%> did so <S%H6213><s%>, as the Lord <S%H3068><s%> had commanded <S%H6680><s%> him <S%H5221><s%>; and struck the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> from Geba <S%H1387><s%> until you come <S%H935><s%> to Gazer <S%H1507><s%>.
